verse: Meanwhile, back in Judah, Hezekiah became very sick and was about to die. Learning of it, Isaiah, Amoz’s son, went to visit him.
Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and started praying.
Then a different word from the Eternal came upon the prophet Isaiah.
When Hezekiah, king of Judah, recovered from his illness, he composed a poem.
Isaiah instructed the physicians to apply a compress of squashed figs to the boil on Hezekiah’s skin to help him recover.
